column1: proc_level0`Level 0`L0`Unprocessed instrument and payload data at full resolution. CCI does not make recommendations regarding formats or content for data at this processing level.`https://www.ghrsst.org/
proc_level1A`Level 1A`L1A`Reconstructed unprocessed instrument data at full resolution
column4: including radiometric and geometric calibration coefficients and georeferencing parameters

column1: proc_level1B`Level 1B`L1B`Level 1A data that have been processed to sensor units.`https://www.ghrsst.org/
proc_level1C`Level 1C`L1C`Level 1b data that have been further processed
column2: e.g. by correcting radiances or by mapping onto a spatial grid
column3: prior to deriving geophysical variables from the data.`

column1: proc_level2`Level 2`L2`Retrieved environmental variables at the same resolution and location as the level 1 source`http://wiki.ieee-earth.org/@api/deki/files/7/=Handbook_0802.pdf
proc_level2P`Level 2 Pre-processing`L2P`Geophysical variables derived from Level 1 source data at the same resolution and location as the level 1 data
column2: typically in a satellite projection with geographic information. These data form the fundamental basis for higher level CCI products.`https://www.ghrsst.org/

column1: proc_level3`Level 3`L3`Level 2 variables mapped on a defined grid with reduced requirements for ancillary data. Three types of L3 products are defined.`https://www.ghrsst.org/
proc_level3U`Level 3U`L3U`Uncollated (L3U): L2 data granules remapped to a space grid without combining any observations from overlapping orbits.`
proc_level3C`Level 3C`L3C`Collated (L3C): Observations combined from a single instrument into a space-time grid.`
proc_level3S`Level 3S`L3S`Super-collated (L3S): observations combined from multiple instruments into a space-time grid.`
proc_level4`Level 4`L4`Data sets created from the analysis of lower level data that result in gridded
